title.narrative: 004 NUTRITION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Government and partner capacities to respond to nutrition in humanitarian crises strengthened, which contributes to Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, an increased percentage of under-five girls and boys, adolescent girls, and pregnant and lactating women are appropriately nourished and cared

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partner capacities to respond to nutrition in humanitarian crises strengthened

description.narrative: UNICEF through the Emergency Nutrition Coordination Unit (ENCU, Nutrition Cluster) supported the GoE in developing and implementing multiple emergency nutrition responses for complex crises across the country. In addition, UNICEF ensured a robust coordination of emergency nutrition response at national and sub-national levels through ENCU.UNICEF advocacy resulted in an improved understanding of the GoE and donor community on the importance of nutrition resilience. UNICEF contributed to improved capacity of the FoH, National Disaster Risk Management Commission (NDRMC) and partner NGOs in responding to emergencies, through organizing a training on Nutrition in Emergencies and following up on the implantation. | Status:Met | As-of Date:24/08/2020
